text: is a retired Japanese marathon runner. She won the gold medal at the 1993 World Championships in a time of 2:30:03 hours. In addition she won the Tokyo International Women's Marathon in 1995 and 1998 and the Osaka Ladies Marathon in 1993. Her personal best time was 2:26:10, from January 1994 in Osaka. She finished 17th at the 1996 Summer Olympics. ==Achievements== *All results regarding marathon, unless stated otherwise {| |- !colspan="5"|Representing |- |rowspan=2|1993 |Osaka Ladies Marathon |Osaka, Japan |bgcolor="gold" | 1st |2:26:26 |- |World Championships |Stuttgart, Germany |bgcolor="gold" | 1st |2:30:03 |- |1995 |Tokyo Marathon |Tokyo, Japan |bgcolor="gold" | 1st |2:28:46 |- |1996 |Olympic Games |Atlanta, United States |17th |2:34:31 |- |1998 |Tokyo Marathon |Tokyo, Japan |bgcolor="gold" | 1st |2:28:29 |} ==External links== * * Category:1969 births Category:Living people Category:People from Kazuno, Akita Category:Japanese female long-distance runners Category:Japanese female marathon runners Category:Athletes (track and field) at the 1996 Summer Olympics Category:Olympic athletes of Japan Category:Sportspeople from Akita Prefecture Category:World Athletics Championships medalists Category:World Athletics Championships winners
title: Junko Asari
